title: The Black Douglas
author: Crockett, S. R. (Samuel Rutherford)
snippet: So it came to pass that within the space of half an hour the AvondaleDouglases had sent men to the four airts, young Hugh Douglas himselfriding west, while James stirred the folk of Avondale and Strathavon,and in all the courtyards and streets of the little feudal bourg therebegan the hum and buzz of the war assembly.

title: The Black Douglas
author: Crockett, S. R. (Samuel Rutherford)
snippet: The servitors hadcleared the great hall, and here on a dais, raised above the "marsh"and sheltered by an arras curtain hastily arranged, James the Grossslept on a soft French bed, which he had caused to be brought all theway from his castle of Strathavon on the moors of Lanarkshire.
